 Now, he says, "i'm not playing that again." so looks like he didn't want t=
o play in the first place, "too much to do."

 



-----Original Message---=

From: Rj <rasterer@...>
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Mo=
n, Jul 19, 2010 3:16 pm
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Experiment 2  - RESULTS!

  =
        =C2=A0                                  David would be wrong then.=
=C2=A0 I carefully put that chair there and took the picture, before I noti=
fied anyone of the test. And let me tell you, working on my computer with t=
hat chair balanced above me for 3 days is not for the faint of heart.=C2=A0=
 I uploaded the picture to the RJ folder when I said I would, and revealed =
the contents when I said I would.=C2=A0 The chair remained there the entire=
 time, and was just removed about a half hour ago.=C2=A0 There was no ink p=
en near it.



--- On Mon, 7/19/10, SnowfireL@... <SnowfireL@...=
> wrote:

From: SnowfireL@... <SnowfireL@...>
Subject: Re:=
 [EVP-ITC] Experiment 2  - RESULTS!
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Date: Monda=
y, July 19, 2010, 12:03  PM

      =C2=A0                              
 RJ=
. David insists you had an ink pen there, and "he changed it."
 
   
 
  
 =

 -----Original Message-----
 From: rasterer <rasterer@yahoo. com>
 T=
o: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
 Sent: Mon, Jul 19, 2010 2:39 pm
 Subject: [EVP=
-ITC] Experiment 2  - RESULTS!
 
             =C2=A0                       =
               Thanks to everyone who participated in Experiment 2.
  
  On=
 Friday, 7/16/2010 I placed an object on top of my computer monitor, right =
in front of me, and left it there until noon Denver time on Monday, 7/19/20=
10.   This experiment asked for participants to determine what that object =
was. Vague or partial answers would not be counted (for example, just givin=
g a color, shape, size,  what it's made of, etc): we're looking for what it=
 is. Answers anyone reveals after noon Denver time Monday won't count.  Par=
ticipants can use their ghost boxes, EVP recorders, or any other means they=
 chose.  
  
  In order to keep me honest, I took a picture of the object a=
t the start of the experiment and loaded it to the Files section (RJ folder=
) of this group.  The idea with this file is that you could download it at =
the beginning of the experiment and 'keep it safe' on your computer. Then a=
t the end of the experiment, I would post the password so you can reveal th=
e contents of the file. That way, you were in control of the original image=
 during the entire time, not me.  
  
  Passworded pdf: http://tech. groups=
.yahoo. com/group/ EVP-ITC/files/ RJ/RJ20100716. pdf
  
  The password for =
that file is: 2plus2isFour
  Instructions, if you need them for the other f=
iles, are also in that RJ folder.
  
  So to the results:
  
  Number of pa=
rticipants: 6
  Total tries: 29
  Ambiguous answers: 0
  Correct answers: 0=

  
  Object: Chair
  Object picture: http://tech. groups.yahoo. com/group/=
 EVP-ITC/files/ RJ/RJ20100716. jpg
  
  As a little side experiment, on Mon=
day I also asked if anyone had gotten any answers that might indicate an ar=
ticle of clothing (though I did not say why I was asking).   One theory is =
that the human operator can be influenced by things they already know or su=
spect, and so interpret audio with their own personal 'educated guesses', t=
hat would differ from what they would hear had they not known those things.=
  This side experiment did indicate some support for that theory, since bef=
ore I mentioned 'articles of clothing', no one included an article of cloth=
ing in their results.  But after I mentioned it, several reports of clothin=
g began to appear.  I did not add these tries to the results above.
  
  If=
 anyone has any observations, comments, or ideas for improvement, let me kn=
ow. Again, thanks to everyone who participated in this experiment.
  
  
  =
     
                   
    
        
    

      
              

      =
  
      
                 
   
       
  


----------MB_8CCF58EBBAA7142_37D0_751F_Webmail-d111.sysops.aol.com

David would be wrong then.  I carefully put that chair there and took =
the picture, before I notified anyone of the test. And let me tell you, wor=
king on my computer with that chair balanced above me for 3 days is not for=
 the faint of heart.  I uploaded the picture to the RJ folder when I s=
aid I would, and revealed the contents when I said I would.  The chair=
 remained there the entire time, and was just removed about a half hour ago=
.  There was no ink pen near it.<br>

<div>Thanks to everyone who participated in Experiment=
 2.<br>
  <br>
  On Friday, 7/16/2010 I placed an object on top of my compu=
ter monitor, right in front of me, and left it there until noon Denver time=
 on Monday, 7/19/2010.   This experiment asked for participants to determin=
e what that object was. Vague or partial answers would not be counted (for =
example, just giving a color, shape, size,  what it's made of, etc): we're =
looking for what it is. Answers anyone reveals after noon Denver time Monda=
y won't count.  Participants can use their ghost boxes, EVP recorders, or a=
ny other means they chose.  <br>
  <br>
  In order to keep me honest, I too=
k a picture of the object at the start of the experiment and loaded it to t=
he Files section (RJ folder) of this group.  The idea with this file is tha=
t you could download it at the beginning of the experiment and 'keep it saf=
e' on your computer. Then at the end of the experiment, I would post the pa=
ssword so you can reveal the contents of the file. That way, you were in co=
ntrol of the original image during the entire time, not me.  <br>
  <br>
  =
Passworded pdf: <a rel=3D"nofollow" target=3D"_blank" href=3D"http://tech.g=
roups.yahoo.com/group/EVP-ITC/files/RJ/RJ20100716.pdf">http://tech. groups.=
yahoo. com/group/ EVP-ITC/files/ RJ/RJ20100716. pdf</a><br>
  <br>
  The pa=
ssword for that file is: 2plus2isFour<br>
  Instructions, if you need them =
for the other files, are also in that RJ folder.<br>
  <br>
  So to the res=
ults:<br>
  <br>
  Number of participants: 6<br>
  Total tries: 29<br>
  Am=
biguous answers: 0<br>
  Correct answers: 0<br>
  <br>
  Object: Chair<br>
=
  Object picture: <a rel=3D"nofollow" target=3D"_blank" href=3D"http://tech=
.groups.yahoo.com/group/EVP-ITC/files/RJ/RJ20100716.jpg">http://tech. group=
s.yahoo. com/group/ EVP-ITC/files/ RJ/RJ20100716. jpg</a><br>
  <br>
  As a=
 little side experiment, on Monday I also asked if anyone had gotten any an=
swers that might indicate an article of clothing (though I did not say why =
I was asking).   One theory is that the human operator can be influenced by=
 things they already know or suspect, and so interpret audio with their own=
 personal 'educated guesses', that would differ from what they would hear h=
ad they not known those things.  This side experiment did indicate some sup=
port for that theory, since before I mentioned 'articles of clothing', no o=
ne included an article of clothing in their results.  But after I mentioned=
 it, several reports of clothing began to appear.  I did not add these trie=
s to the results above.<br>
  <br>
  If anyone has any observations, commen=
ts, or ideas for improvement, let me know. Again, thanks to everyone who pa=
rticipated in this experiment.<br>
  <br>
  </div>
